snippet: Beyond Oblivion had a roster of blue-chip investors for its product, Boinc, which would include music on home electronics devices. However, the licensing agreements proved too great a hurdle.
abstract: Beyond Oblivion had a roster of blue-chip investors for its product, Boinc, which would include music on home electronics devices. However, the licensing agreements proved too great a hurdle.
lead_paragraph: Beyond Oblivion, a digital music start-up company that raised $87 million from blue-chip investors like News Corporation, closed its doors last week without ever introducing what was supposed to be its signature product, Boinc.

headline.main: $87 Million Later, Music Start-Up Closes Before Going to Market
